content: Yes, there were several prominent musicians and composers associated with the Dada music movement, including Kurt Schwitters, Hans Richter, Raoul Hausmann, Richard Huelsenbeck, Francis Picabia, Marcel Duchamp, and Erik Satie. These artists experimented with new sounds, unconventional instruments, and non-traditional approaches to composition and performance, often incorporating found objects, spoken word, and other elements of everyday life into their music. Their work helped to lay the groundwork for later movements like Surrealism and Fluxus.
